data.meta_site_name: CINEMAFANTASTIQUE - FOR THE LOVE OF GENRE FILMS
data.text:
For educational purposes only!

WHAT’S THIS ALL ABOUT?

This summer, Shivers Film Society and UBC Film Society present Vancouver’s first-ever TROMAFEST! Yes, that’s right, the first-ever Troma & master indie filmmaker Lloyd Kaufman retrospective, to be held at the Norm Theatre at UBC. All day Troma films, from The Toxic Avenger to the classic Tromeo & Juliet to the musical Tromasterpiece Poultrygeist, PLUS, Lloyd Kaufman will be conducting a very special 90-minute Master Class Seminar on-site! Tromerchandise will be available throughout the day, come and hang out with us and the ever-entertaining and energetic (and brilliant) Mr. Kaufman, co-founder and president of Troma, the longest-running independent movie studio in the world!

JULY 18, 2015!

AT THE NORM THEATRE at UBC

(From August, 2015)

Well, we’re still winding down from this summer’s amazing Cinemafantastique fest and Vancouver’s first-ever Tromafest! But there’s more in store as we roll into the Autumn months…

Shivers Film Society is partnering with Scalarama in the UK (sponsored by the BFI) to bring a little John Waters love to the big screen. This September, the BFI and Scalarama are launching a huge John Waters 50th filmmaking anniversary retrospective. Yes, the mad genius has been making films for fifty years now! As part of this celebration, the Shivers Film Society will be presenting a Scalarama screening of John Water’s Cecil B. Demented double-billed with Troma’s Terror Firmer (directed by Lloyd Kaufman) in a night celebrating anarchy in filmmaking! Sunday, September 13th, 7:00 pm at the Norm Theatre (UBC).

https://www.facebook.com/events/1668979923335997/

ALL ADMISSIONS BY DONATION!
